member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCamera.Connect
member.summary: Connect to camera resource and register callbacks. Only one connection to the camera resource is supported at a time.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.UnexpectedNull if failed to connect to camera device due to null pointer. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Timeout if failed to connect to camera device due to timeout. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCamera.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnect from camera resource and unregister callbacks.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCamera.CaptureImage(System.String)
member.summary: Captures an image from the camera and writes a jpeg to the specified path.
member.param: Path to write the captured image.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed due to internal invalid input parameter. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.UnexpectedNull if failed due to null pointer. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.BadType if failed due to invalid capture type. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.InvalidOperation if failed due to on-going video recording. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Timeout if failed due to timeout. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCamera.CaptureRawImageAsync(UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCameraOutputFormat)
member.summary: Initiates a raw image capture request. Register to OnRawImageAvailable event to get result if format is JPEG. OnRawImageAvailableYUV to get result if format is YUV_420_888
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.UnexpectedNull if failed due to null pointer. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.BadType if failed due to invalid capture type. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.InvalidOperation if failed due to on-going video recording. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Timeout if failed due to timeout. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed due to internal invalid input parameter.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCamera.StartVideoCapture(System.String)
member.summary: Starts capturing a video to write as an MP4 to the specified path.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.UnexpectedNull if failed due to null pointer. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.BadType if failed to prepare for capture due to invalid capture type. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Timeout if failed due to timeout. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed due to internal invalid input parameter.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCamera.StopVideoCapture
member.summary: Stops capturing a video and write as an MP4 to the path specified with StartVideoCapture().
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.UnexpectedNull if failed due to null pointer. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed to start video recording due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCamera.PrepareCapture(UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCameraCaptureType,UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCameraCaptureSettings@)
member.summary: Prepare a capture for manual submission, allowing modifying of the capture settings.
member.param: The type of capture you will be submitting. This must match the capture type of SubmitCapture()
Structure containing all of the existing capture settings that can be viewed or modified. Must be passed into SubmitCapture
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed to prepare for capture due to invalid input parameter. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.UnexpectedNull if failed to prepare for capture due to null pointer. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.BadType if failed to prepare for capture due to invalid capture type. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed to prepare for capture due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCamera.SubmitCapture(UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCameraCaptureSettings@,System.String)
member.summary: Submit a previously prepared capture and execute the capture itself. If MLCameraCaptureType.Video is submitted, users must call StopVideoCapture() to stop capture at a later time.
member.param: Structure containing the settings used for this capture
When captureType is of type Video or Image (but not ImageRaw), filePath must be a valid target path for the output capture
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.InvalidOperation if failed to capture image due to on-going video recording. MLResult.Code will be MLMediaGenericResult.UnexpectedNull if failed to start capture or recording due to null pointer. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed to start capture or recording due to invalid input parameter. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Timeout if failed to start capture or recording due to timeout. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed to start video recording due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLCamera.GetErrorCode
member.summary: Returns the most recent error code.
member.returns: Most recent MLCameraError.

member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if the texture passed in is invalid (null) MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if some other failure occured.

member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLDispatcher
member.summary: This interface is to let an application query the platform to handle things that the app itself cannot or wants someone else to handle. For example, if an application comes across a schema tag that it doesn't know what to do with, it can query the patform to see if some other application might. This can be useful for handling http://, https:// or other customSchema://<arg1>/<arg2> Apart from handling schema tags in URIs, this interface can also be used to query the platform to handle a type of file based on file-extension or mime-type

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLDispatcher.TryOpenAppropriateApplication(System.String)
member.summary: Try to open the application that is registered to support the given URI.
member.param: The URI to pass into the dispatch service.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed due to an internal invalid input parameter. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be an MLDispatchResult if a dispatch specific error occurred.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLDispatcher.GetResultString(UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLResultCode)
member.summary: Gets a readable version of the result code as an ASCII string.
member.param: The MLResult that should be converted.
member.returns: ASCII string containing a readable version of the result code.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLIdentityProfile.Fetch(System.Action{UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLResult})
member.summary: Fetch the specified attributes and callback when result is known.
member.param: MLResult.Code in callback will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed due to invalid null internal parameter. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if caller does not have the IdentityRead privilege. MLResult.Code will be an MLIdentityResult if an identity specific failure occurred during the operation.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Pending if successful (request will be pending). MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed due to invalid null internal parameter. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if caller does not have the IdentityRead privilege. MLResult.Code will be an MLIdentityResult if an identity specific failure occurred during the operation.

member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTargetTrackingStatus
member.summary: Identifies the status of an image target. Each MLImageTargetResult will include a ImageTrackerTargetStatus giving the current status of the target.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTargetTrackingStatus.Tracked
member.summary: Image target is tracked. The image tracker system will provide a 6 DOF pose when queried using MLSnapshotGetTransform function.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTargetTrackingStatus.Unreliable
member.summary: Image target is tracked with low confidence. The image tracker system will still provide a 6 DOF pose. But this pose might be inaccurate and might have jitter. When the tracking is unreliable one of the following two events will happen quickly : Either the tracking will recover to MLImageTrackerTargetStatus_Tracked or tracking will be lost and the status will change to MLImageTrackerTargetStatus_NotTracked.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTargetTrackingStatus.NotTracked
member.summary: Image target is lost. The image tracker system will not report any pose for this target. Querying for the pose using MLSnapshotGetTransform will return false.

member.summary: Represents the image target result.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTargetResult.Position
member.summary: Position of the target. This is not valid if the target is not being tracked.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTargetResult.Rotation
member.summary: Orientation of the target. This is not valid if the target is not being tracked.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTargetResult.Status
member.summary: Status of the target. Every target will have an associated status indicating the current tracking status.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTarget.#ctor(System.String,UnityEngine.Texture2D,System.Single,System.Action{UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTarget,UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTargetResult},System.UInt64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs the MLImageTarget object with specified parameters. Image target's name. Texture2D representing the image target. The size of the texture should not be changed. Set the "Non Power of 2" property of Texture2D to none. Longer dimension of the image target in scene units. Default is meters. Tracking result callback for this image target. Handle for the image tracker. Set this to true if the position of this image target in the physical world is fixed and its surroundings are planar (ex: walls, floors, tables, etc).

member.name: P:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLInput.TriggerDownThreshold
member.summary: The threshold used to determine when the trigger has been squeezed enough to be considered pressed. The trigger will remain in the pressed state until its reading goes below TriggerUpThreshold. TriggerDownThreshold must be larger than TriggerUpThreshold.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLInput.TriggerUpThreshold
member.summary: The threshold used to determine when the trigger has been released enough to be considered released. The trigger will remain in the released state until its reading goes above TriggerDownThreshold. TriggerUpThreshold must be smaller than TriggerDownThreshold.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLInputController.UseCFUIDTransforms
member.summary: Set/Get whether CFUID (Coordinate Frame Unique ID) tracking is being used to get 6DOF transforms on the control. You can toggle this to test CFUID (fast but jittery) based tracking vs MLInput (laggy but less jittery) tracking. But that works only if you have enabled it in MLInputConfiguration at the time of calling MLInput.Start otherwise this value is ignored.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLTokenAgent.GetClientCredentials(UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLTokenAgent.MLTokenAgentClientCredentials@)
member.summary: GetClientCredentials is a blocking function that accesses the cloud and returns a MLTokenAgentClientCredentials structure containing the users credentials and tokens for a particular service (Audience). The library deduces the Audience being requested from the name of the calling service.
member.param: MLTokenAgentClientCredentials output reference to a structure which was created with all its fields by the library. It must only be released using ReleaseClientCredentials.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed due to internal invalid input parameter. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing. MLResult.Code will be an MLTokenAgentResult if a token specific failure occurred during the operation.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLTokenAgent.GetClientCredentialsAsync(System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: GetClientCredentialsAsync invokes the GetClientCredentials function asynchronously (in a different thread).
member.param: A pointer to an MLInvokeFuture pointer which provides the means to poll for completion and to retrieve the credentials returned by MLTokenAgentGetClientCredentials. This pointer will be freed by the library before returning from the first (and last) call to MLTokenAgentGetClientCredentialsWait, after the asynchronous call completed, that is after MLTokenAgentGetClientCredentialsWait returns any value that is not MLResult.Pending.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed due to internal invalid input parameter. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing. MLResult.Code will be an MLTokenAgentResult if a token specific failure occurred during the operation.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLTokenAgent.GetClientCredentialsWait(UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLInvokeFuture,System.UInt32,UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLTokenAgent.MLTokenAgentClientCredentials@)
member.summary: Having made a call to MLTokenAgentGetClientCredentialsAsync, the user can call MLTokenAgentGetClientCredentialsWait to detect whether the asynchronous call completed and if so, to retrieve the credentials in outCredentials. The call to MLTokenAgentGetClientCredentialsWait blocks until either msecTimeout msec elapses or the asynchronous function completes.
member.param: MLInvokeFuture returned by the GetClientCredentialsAsync function

Output reference where the credentials structure created by the library will be copied, if the asynchronous call completed. The location pointed to by out_credentials was set to the address of the MLTokenAgentClientCredentials structure allocated by the library. The returned credentils must be released when no longer needed by calling MLTokenAgentReleaseClientCredentials If any other value is returned, the location pointed to by outCredentials is set to 0 (null).
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if the operation completed successfully before the timeout elapsed. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Pending if the timeout elapsed before the operation completed. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed due to internal invalid input parameter. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed due to internal error. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.AllocFailed if failed to allocate memory. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing. MLResult.Code will be an MLTokenAgentResult if a token specific failure occurred during the operation.
member.remarks: Note: 1. To poll without blocking use msecTimeout = 0 2. After the function returns true, future is freed by the library and must not be used again in a call to MLTokenAgentGetClientCredentialsWait.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLTokenAgent.ReleaseClientCredentials(UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLTokenAgent.MLTokenAgentClientCredentials@)
member.summary: ReleaseClientCredentials releases all resources associated with the MLTokenAgentClientCredentials stucture that was returned by the library.
member.param: MLTokenAgentClientCredentials reference to a strcuture received using one of: GetClientCredentials or GetClientCredentialsWait.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if the operation completed successfully before the timeout elapsed. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if failed due to internal invalid input parameter.

member.returns: ASCII string containing a readable version of the result code.

members.member:
Delegate used to convey the result of a raycast.
The state of the raycast result. Where in the world the collision happened. Normal to the surface where the ray collided. The confidence of the ray cast result. member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLContentBinding
member.summary: MLContentBinding class represents the binding between the virtual object/user content and the Persistent coordinate frame (PCF). It stores the offset of the content with respect to the PCF and restores it from the persistent store (MLPersistentStore).

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLContentBinding.ObjectId
member.summary: Virtual object identifier.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLContentBinding.PCF
member.summary: PCF that the virtual object is bound to

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLContentBinding.BindingType
member.summary: Binding representing the connection between PCF and ObjectId.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLContentBinding.Offset
member.summary: The offset of the virtual object to the PCF.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLContentBinding.OrientationOffset
member.summary: The orientation offset from PCF.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLContentBinding.GameObject
member.summary: Gets or sets the game object. GameObject represents the virtual content.

member.name: P:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLContentBinding.IsValid
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is valid.
member.value: true if is valid; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLContentBinding.Update
member.summary: Updates the binding information based on the PCF and GameObject locations. It will child the game object under the game object representing the PCF. It checks if the PCF is a good state before carrying out this operation
member.returns: MLResult.code will be MLResult.Ok when operation is successful MLResult.code will be MLResult.InvalidParam when GameObject is not set or PCF is not set or CurrentResult value in MLPCF is not Ok

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLContentBinding.Restore(System.Action{UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLContentBinding,UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLResult})
member.summary: Restores the binding between the PCF and the virtual object and returns the result through the callback. Restoration includes childing the virtual object under PCF game object. and restoring the old local offsets (rotation and position). Callback to be called when the restore finishes.
member.returns: MLResult.code will be MLResult.Ok when operation is successful MLResult.code will be MLResult.InvalidParam when GameObject is not set or PCF is not set or CurrentResult value in MLPCF is not Ok MLResult.code will be MLResult.UnspecifiedFailure when MLPersistentCoordinateFrames is not started

member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if successful. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.PrivilegeDenied if necessary privilege is missing. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if failed due to other internal error. member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerBehavior
member.summary: MLImageTrackerBehavior encapsulates the functionality to track images Avoid making references to this behavior from OnApplicationPause since the underlying system will likely be disabled.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerBehavior.Image
member.summary: Image that needs to be tracked. Do not resize the image, the aspect ratio of the image provided here and the printed image should be the same. Set the "Non Power of 2" property of Texture2D to none.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerBehavior.IsStationary
member.summary: Set this to true if the position of this image target in the physical world is fixed and its surroundings are planar (ex: walls, floors, tables, etc).

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerBehavior.AutoUpdate
member.summary: Set this to true if the behavior should automatically move the attached game object.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerBehavior.LongerDimensionInSceneUnits
member.summary: Longer dimension of the printed image target in scene units. If width is greater than height, it is the width, height otherwise.

member.name: E:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerBehavior.OnTargetFound
member.summary: Occurs when an existing image target is found. Bool value indicates whether the tracking result is good or unreliable.

member.name: E:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerBehavior.OnTargetLost
member.summary: Occurs when the image target is lost.

member.name: E:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerBehavior.OnTargetUpdated
member.summary: Occurs when the result gets updated for the image target and happens once every frame. This provides the target position, orientation, and tracking status.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerBehavior.Awake
member.summary: Start the image tracker and the image target to the tracking system.

member.summary: Handle the image target result callback. This is called every frame.

member.summary: Get the longer dimension of the Image Target. This should not be called before the image target is added to the tracker system.
member.param: longer dimension of the image target in scene units.
member.returns: true if the dimension was successfully fetched, false otherwise.

member.summary: Set the longer dimension of the Image Target. This method can be used to change the dimension of the image target at runtime. This should not be called before the image target is added to the tracker system.
member.param: longer dimension of the image target in scene units.

member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerTargetSettings
member.summary: Represents the settings of an Image Target All fields are required for an Image Target to be tracked.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerTargetSettings.Name
member.summary: Name of the target - This name has to be unique across all targets added to the Image Tracker. - Caller should allocate memory for this. - Encoding should be in UTF8. - This will be copied internally.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerTargetSettings.LongerDimension
member.summary: LongerDimension refer to the size of the longer dimension of the physical Image Target in Unity scene units..

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerTargetSettings.IsStationary
member.summary: Set this to \c true to improve detection for stationary targets. - An Image Target is a stationary target if its position in the physical world does not change. - This is best suited for cases where the target is stationary and when the local geometry (environment surrounding the target) is planar. - When in doubt set this to false.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerTargetSettings.IsEnabled
member.summary: Set this to \c true to track the image target. - Disabling the target when not needed marginally improves the tracker CPU performance. - This is best suited for cases where the target is temporarily not needed. If the target no longer needs to be tracked it is best to use remove the target.

member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerImageFormat
member.summary: When adding image targets to the Image Tracker using MLImageTrackerAddTargetFromArraySpecify the image format using this enum.

member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerSettings
member.summary: Represents the list of Image Tracker settings.

member.name: F:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLImageTrackerSettings.MaxSimultaneousTargets
member.summary: Maximum number of Image Targets that can be tracked at any given time. If the tracker is already tracking the maximum number of targets possible then it will stop searching for new targets which helps reduce the load on the CPU. For example, if you are interested in tracking a maximum of x targets simultaneously from a list y (x < y) targets then set this parameter to x. The valid range for this parameter is from 1 through 25.

member.name: M:MagicLeapInternal.MLTextureUtils.ConvertToByteArray(UnityEngine.Texture2D,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Convert Unity Texture2D to a byte array. Texture2D should be in one of the following formats: DXT1, RGBA32, RGB24. For DXT1 and RGBA32, resulting byte array is in RGBA format. For RGB24, resulting byte array is in RGB format. The origin of the byte array will be at the top left corner. Returns null on unsupported formats.
member.param: Texture to extract byte array from
Out parameter to determine how many bytes per pixel

member.name: T:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLPrivilegeId
member.summary: Privilege Types: AutoGranted - Once it is included in the manifest the application is granted the privilege. Sensitive - Must be requested at runtime, as well as in the manifest, because it requires user consent on first use. Reality - Must be requested at runtime and every time the application gains focus, as well as in the manifest, because it requires user consent every active session.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLPrivileges.CheckPrivilege(UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLPrivilegeId)
member.summary: Checks whether the application has the specified privileges. This does not solicit consent from the end-user.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLPrivilegesResult.Granted if the privilege is granted. MLResult.Code will be MLPrivilegesResult.Denied if the privilege is denied. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if the privilege system was not started.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLPrivileges.RequestPrivilege(UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLPrivilegeId)
member.summary: Requests the specified privileges. This may possibly solicit consent from the end-user.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLPrivilegesResult.Granted if the privilege is granted. MLResult.Code will be MLPrivilegesResult.Denied if the privilege is denied. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if the privilege system was not started.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLPrivileges.RequestPrivilegeAsync(UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLPrivilegeId,System.Action{UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLResult,UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLPrivilegeId})
member.summary: Request the specified privileges. This may solicit consent from the end-user.
member.param: Callback to be executed when the privilege request has completed. The MLResult.Code returned could be one of the following: - MLPrivilegesResult.Granted if the privilege is granted. - MLPrivilegesResult.Denied if the privilege is denied. - MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if the privilege system was not started.
member.returns: MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.Ok if the privilege request is in progress. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.InvalidParam if request is a null pointer or the callback is not valid. MLResult.Code will be MLResultCode.UnspecifiedFailure if the privilege system was not started.

member.summary: Process pending requests and call the callback specified in the startup config.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLPrivileges.ProcessCompletedQueries
member.summary: Go through all completed queries and publish their results also clean them up.

member.name: M:UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLPrivileges.RequestPrivilegeStatus(UnityEngine.XR.MagicLeap.MLPrivilegeId)
member.summary: Try to get the result from a privilege request. The request object is internally freed when the result is ready (i.e. retval is either MLPrivilegesResult.Granted or MLPrivilegesResult.Denied).
